content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: This puzzle presents a visually satisfying experience with its hexagonal grid and complex path segments.
Could you check 14 - Combo Breaker for me? It is significantly different than 28 - Combo Breaker Validator and that makes me wonder if something is not right.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle with excellent visuals!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting puzzle, with nice graphics. Test coverage is complete and error messages are meaningful.

Episode 2 is already in progress and all issues are fixed for this one.
Game is READY
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Incorporated Timinator's and 5DN1L's comments
- turn output requires semicolon between each pair of path segments
- statement and referee adjusted based on that rule
- added Turn output example.

Great puzzle! I only have one comment on the output. Did you consider putting the quintuples on separate lines instead of space-separated quintuples?

I got confused a lot trying to solve it, but I think it is just a mind-bender of a game. I don't see anything that could be better clarified in the instructions.

Hi, nice graphics, I tried to solve it and I'm passing some tests. I have a question about the score. In "longer path no reuse" I passed 11 cells but the score is 11. Is that correct?
"For example, if a path passes through 5 segments, the player earns 15 points in total."
Game is ready... I'll keep it in WIP until Episode 2 is ready too. Enjoy!

Rules
* Consider changing "This means," to "It follows that" (without any comma).

* Please change "is same as" to "is the same as". Also, do you mean (3-7) is the same as (7-3) instead of (3-7)?

* Scoring: Please change "crossed" to "followed" or "passed through".

Turn input
* Please add "a" before "path segment".

Tags
* Is "Reading the statement" needed? There isn't a lot to read nor is the statement particularly complexâ€¦ ðŸ¤”

Error messages
* "Incorrect path segment" (out-of-range entrances): Consider adding "entrances" before "should be 0 and 11" and deleting "including".

* "Incorrect path segment" (same entrance and exit): Details aren't included in the error message in the console (the message ends with "the same position:").

* "Your path doesn't match": Details aren't included in the error message in the console.

Thanks.

Still in progress (missing testcases)

Episode 1 (EASY) - This one
Episode 2 (HARD) - You'll receive all the tiles and their placement at the beginning and will be allowed to rotate n of them (adjusting the board) to maximize score
Episode 3 (VERY HARD) - You'll receive all the tiles in order they will be placed on the board

I'll make multi with simillar mechanics

Coordinate System (if board size is fixed) *OR* Constraints (if board size is not fixed)
* Please specify the range of the x and y-coordinates.

Coordinate System
* The current illustration shows coordinate ranges from -2 to 2. If ranges from -3 to 3 are used for all the test cases (assuming that's the fixed size), consider updating the image accordingly to show the whole board.

Thanks.

Hi,

I had the same issue, here's how it works.
Each turn you will pass along 1 or several tiles.
Each turn the score increases based on how many tiles were passed during the current turn.
At any turn if you pass by 1 tile the score will increase by 1
At any turn if you pass by 3 tiles the score will increase by 6 (1+2+3)
At any turn if you pass by 5 tiles the score will increase by 15 (1+2+3+4+5)
...
When coding SOLO game - referee must know how many lines player would output in next turn. I can require '/' or other symbol there, but not newline :(

Two points:

Cases
* "Longer path no-reuse" and "Longer path no-cycles" are the only test-validator pair of cases with different names.

Turn output
* Note that exiting from #7 at [0, -1] should lead to #0 at [0, -2], not #1, so the example may be a bit confusing. Nevertheless, it's up to you whether you want to update the example.

Thank you.
Those are basically random testcases. I probably won't rework those
I totally agree with @Timinator - the test SHOULD be changed to align with the validator.
Wow... I didn't check it, but its huge missconfiguration - fixed. Now the Combo breaker test is simply horizontal swap of Combo Breaker validator.
No worries! It's all right now. Thank you.
How about a ";" like we often see in multiplayer games.
Would highlighting "during this move" (in the Scoring section) in bold help understanding? Or should the wording be revised to make it clearer?

It would definitely help, thanks. I also think a complete example would be helpful. Also, in the output description, should only two lines be expected, or should the entire path be listed after the first line with the score? I also think the difficulty level could be medium.
Not sure about difficulty being medium, but the rules can be more clear for sure. Updated both. Let me know if you are OK with that and I'll mark the puzzle as ready. TY
I thought you mentioned, "I'll keep it in WIP until Episode 2 is ready too."?
True... but is it really necessary? :P

I assume you made that earlier decision for a good reason ðŸ˜›

In response to @Eulero314's comment about the output, I suggest changing the section heading "Output" to "Turn output" for clarity.

The reason was to not make "Episode 1" version of a puzzle without further episodes. You are right... I'll mark it as ready after having at least draft of "Episode 2". Statement updated + some changes were made based on Timinator's comment

All fixed + added multiple testcases.
I wanted to cover all possible path segments in both directions. Still some issues there :|

* "I wanted to cover all possible path segments in both directions. Still some issues there": has that issue been resolved?

Coordinate System
* Image: Please change [-3,-0] to [-3,0].

Error messages
* Can "(normalized entrances)" be deleted? The error message should be understandable without adding that. Or, is it possible to store the original entrance order so that the error message will always match the player's output?

Thanks.
image and error message updated. Testcases are also correct.
Thank you! I don't see other issues right now, except for the potential change in the Scoring section (see the thread started by @Eulero314).
